props.description:
Specifies the number of breadcrumb items to display after truncation.
This is useful for managing the display of long breadcrumb lists.
props.title: itensAfterTruncate

props.description: The content of the breadcrumbs, which should be one or more Breadcrumb.Item components or other React nodes.
props.title: children

props.description: A ref to the element rendered by this component. Because this component is polymorphic, the type will vary based on the value of the as prop.
props.title: ref

props.description: The underlying element to render â€” either a HTML element name or a React component.
props.title: as

props.description: The name of the breadcrumb item. This is typically the text that is displayed for the item.
props.title: name

props.description: The content of the breadcrumb item. This can include text, icons, or other React elements.
props.title: children

props.description:
An icon to be displayed alongside the breadcrumb item.
This can be used to provide a visual representation of the item.
props.title: icon

props.description:
Indicates whether the breadcrumb item is currently active.
An active item is typically styled differently to show that it represents the current page.
props.title: active
